13217	LTW_ENG_20070404.0066.LDC2009T13	The chances of getting HPV are slim.
13229	LTW_ENG_20070404.0066.LDC2009T13	The vaccine is not effective if a female is already sexually active.
13232	LTW_ENG_20070404.0066.LDC2009T13	ANSWERS
13240	LTW_ENG_20070404.0066.LDC2009T13	"Although the median age for cervical cancer diagnosis is 48, it has been detected in females as young as 17."
13243	LTW_ENG_20070404.0066.LDC2009T13	False.
13245	LTW_ENG_20070404.0066.LDC2009T13	"The virus is transmitted skin to skin, not through bodily fluids."
13248	LTW_ENG_20070404.0066.LDC2009T13	False.
13249	LTW_ENG_20070404.0066.LDC2009T13	At least half of sexually active people will acquire genital HPV virus in their lifetime.
13250	LTW_ENG_20070404.0066.LDC2009T13	"By age 50, at least 80 percent of females will have been infected."
13253	LTW_ENG_20070404.0066.LDC2009T13	"True, at least for now."

13257	LTW_ENG_20070404.0066.LDC2009T13	"True, although a male vaccine is in development."
13260	LTW_ENG_20070404.0066.LDC2009T13	Herpes (HSV) differs from HPV
13261	LTW_ENG_20070404.0066.LDC2009T13	it does not cause the same symptoms or pose the same health problems.
13263	LTW_ENG_20070404.0066.LDC2009T13	False.
13264	LTW_ENG_20070404.0066.LDC2009T13	About 70 percent of cervical cancers can be prevented by the vaccine.
13266	LTW_ENG_20070404.0066.LDC2009T13	False.
13267	LTW_ENG_20070404.0066.LDC2009T13	"The vaccine has been found to be about 90 percent effective in preventing genital warts and may provide some protection against precancers of the vulva, vagina and cervix."
13269	LTW_ENG_20070404.0066.LDC2009T13	False.
13273	LTW_ENG_20070404.0066.LDC2009T13	There is no evidence that vaccination has any effect on behavior.
